intro: Senecio doronicum subsp. lagascanus, commonly known as the Lagascanus groundsel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. This subspecies is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
